labels.analysis: The MCP Server functions as a specialized weather forecast service, primarily focused on providing real-time meteorological data through a standardized protocol. Its core functionality revolves around retrieving live temperature data for specific geographic coordinates, enabling applications to integrate accurate and up-to-date weather information. This server serves as a weather data provider that can be used to enhance decision-making processes in various applications by supplying reliable environmental context.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Weather" is chosen because the server's core functionality is explicitly about providing weather-related data (temperature in this case). While the predefined "Weather" category directly matches the server's purpose, the secondary label "API Integration" is added because the server's description emphasizes "seamless integration of weather data." There is no need for a custom label as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

tools.name: get_live_temp
tools.description: Get live temperature for a given latitude and longitude.

server_info_crawled.name: Weather Forecast Server
server_info_crawled.author: @myrve/weather-forecast-mcp-mevy
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide accurate and up-to-date weather forecasts to your applications. Enable seamless integration of weather data through a standardized protocol. Enhance your agents with reliable environmental context for better decision-making.

tools.name: get_live_temp
tools.description: Get live temperature for a given latitude and longitude.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@myrve/weather-forecast-mcp-mevy/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
